intro: Pauletia platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaf pauletia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
